com.jde.model.physics.collision

Class HitCircle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jde.model.physics.collision.HitCircle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HitZone

    public class HitCircle
extends java.lang.Object
implements HitZone
    This HitCircle class represents a colliding object with a circle shape
    Author:
    HarZe (David Serrano)

      • collides

        public boolean collides(Movement self,
               Movement other,
               double ms)
        Description copied from interface: HitZone
        This method checks if an entity collides with a moving point
        Specified by:
        collides in interface HitZone
        Parameters:
        self - The movement of the entity which contains the hit zone, MUST BE a clone
        other - The movement of the point that is supposed to collide, MUST BE a clone
        ms - The milliseconds to forward
        Returns:
        True if the entities collide

        Description copied from interface: HitZone
        This method checks if a point is inside the hit zone
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        self - The movement of the entity which contains the hit zone
        collider - The position to check
        Returns:
        True if the other entity is inside the hit zone

      • pierces

        protected boolean pierces(Vertex selfPos,
              Movement other,
              double ms)
        This method detects if a moving point is piercing the circle
        Parameters:
        selfPos - Position of this circle
        other - Movement of the piercing object
        ms - Milliseconds to forward
        Returns:
        True if the object pierces the circle
